__e: The innocuous content of the letters, if anyone's curious enough to open and read, was a simple message from "Max" to "Walter" proposing an upcoming meeting.
But it was also very brave and very honest, and I respect you for doing that, but the content of what you said has made me hate you.
~ HE LAUGHS ~ Look at that! It's Letters Molloy, sir.
I'm talking about the years of my life squeezed down to their essence, the raw pulp of truth...
I'm sending one of my officers round to collect the contents of Box Number 552.
Or even give me the gist of it?
I can't say for sure, but the silver- content seem to be around 3-5 percent.
Whatever they contain, they are meant to kill you.
I wonder what's in this book that they saw fit to give it covers made of pure shit."
